title: Are we a collective conscious? - Quora

response.answer_text: Yes, we are. Most of us do not consider our subconscious as part of our conscious. So that right there tells us that we are collective, that multiple entities determine our existence. So let’s dive a bit. Our bodies consist of all kinds of cells. We have more bacterial cells than we do bodily cells. Scientists are just now beginning to grasp just how important our gut bacteria are to our well-being. Sure, you could argue that it’s possible, with enough willpower, to ignore our stomach. I’d tell you that’s a foolish thing to try to do. Each of us has more neurons than exist humans on this Earth. It does not make any sense at all to consider human pan-psychism before considering how in the world it is that we are able to act independently of our minds. How do billions of neurons contribute to one mind? It’s even worse. Our billion neurons have a neural superhighway called the corpus callosum. It connects our two brains together. People are born with congenital corpus callosum defects, in some rare cases it’s actually not present. One person in public consciousness exhibits this, this person’s name was Kim Peek and they made the movie Rain Man from his accounts. The various components of our daily, bodily existence contribute carefully to our daily existence but don’t work hard for it. If we want something totally novel we can go there. But it doesn’t happen by default.,

Of course, We are! Although it is often described and discussed in secular terms with reference to societal norms such as common belief, ideas and moral dispensation, etc. It also has a spiritual dimension; which proves, beyond logic and rationale, the existence and practicality of it. When there is dearth of rain in a region/community, Muslims get together and set out into the open to offer “salat al Istisqa” and, most often than not, it rains. In Christianity. “You visit the earth and water it abundantly, enriching it greatly. God's stream is filled with water, for You prepare the earth in this way, providing [people] with grain” (Psalm, 65:9)

Certainly in some sense. We have this thing called culture that passes down a certain set of awarenesses and values. In Ishmael (1992) Daniel Quinn called it a “cultural matrix.” We all live in it, but this perception-nurturing Mother Culture has no independent existence outside of our heads. She is made of our thoughts. She is made of our minds. She is the collective conscious of which we are a part.

No, I don’t think so. Animals are conscious - to the degree that they are conscious - because they have to be or they will perish. An unconscious animal cannot survive. OK, hibernation means unconscious, but when the animal comes out of hibernation, they better be fully conscious or they won’t pass on their genes. We collectively do not need to be conscious collectively, that is why I don’t think it even exists outside of some peoples’ imaginations.

Collective consciousness…. hmmm… is that Jungian? So much for labels… how about just consciousness? Since I am told God is Consciousness, and we are inseparably a part of God, as soul ego.. (This gets so complicated with words) …. I will stay with Consciousness. We are absolutely linked to one another and to God through consciousness. There are endless varieties of consciousness… but consciouseness is the linking term for me.

What we are is beyond our feeble abilities to conceive or imagine. …beyond collective, beyond conscious, beyond even being or not-being. The intellect can’t know it, but it is possible to glimpse that level of reality in the higher Jhanas (from the Skt. word Dhyana). See the 6th, 7th, & 8th Jhanas. Dhyāna in Buddhism - Wikipedia
No. Within society we do share many common social constructs, we develop and live by a social contract that defines behaviors within our collective society’s and thus share customs, laws and values.
The collect consciousness is one of the levels of consciousness. As for are we a collective conscious I think God consciousness is available to all.
